title: Two year old in Smyrna accidentally shoots herself
content:
SMYRNA, TN (WSMV) -
A 2-year-old girl who accidentally shot herself after finding a gun on Saturday morning is now in stable condition.
Smyrna Police said it was called to a home on Snowbird Drive around 10:53 a.m. in response to a shooting at the residence.
Police said the girl accessed a pistol within the home and accidentally shot herself.
The girl was flown to Vanderbilt University Medical Center. Police said Saturday night she was in stable condition.
Police said no charges have been filed at this time, but the investigation is continuing. Police said all evidence will be given to the District Attorney’s office for evaluation.
